line_1: In vain: his daring axe he heaves,
line_2: Tow'rds the black vein a passage cleaves:
Drew near — and shook the wither'd leaves; —

line_1: High o'er the deep th' embattl'd fortress heaves
line_2: Its awful front, its basis in the waves;

line_1: In vain the pressing Lid his Shoulder heaves;
line_2: Kept back from look'd-for Day the Mortal grieves,

line_1: "But thou whose bosom foreign sorrow heaves,
For all mankind, unknown, his bosom heaves,
line_2: He only injures those with whom he lives.

line_1: He rolls his sanguin'd Eyes, his Bosom heaves,
line_2: And darts with active Rage along the Waves.

line_1: And high in air th' up-rooted empire heaves;
line_2: Its deep foundations his strong trident cleaves,

line_1: And then I exclaim, while my conscious heart heaves,
line_2: HOW fondly I gaze on the fast falling-leaves,

line_1: Frequent for Breath his panting Bosom heaves:
line_2: To broken Sleeps his remnant Sense He gives;

line_1: Frequent for Breath his panting Bosom heaves:
line_2: And only by his Pains, awaking finds He Lives.
